questions.question_text: Which of the following applications allows a user to create backups in macOS?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Time Machine
Here's why:

Time Machine: Time Machine is the built-in backup feature in macOS. It automatically backs up files, apps, system files, and settings to an external drive or network location. Users can restore their system or specific files from these backups.

questions.question_text: A location is experiencing under-voltage events during peak periods. Which of the following should be deployed at this location?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply) provides power to connected devices during power outages and can also stabilize voltage fluctuations, making it ideal for situations with under-voltage events. While a surge protector can protect against power surges, it doesn't address voltage drops. Ventilation and PDUs (Power Distribution Units) are also not designed to handle under-voltage situations.

choices.B: Use bootable antivirus media to scan the system.
choices.C: Download software designed to specifically target the virus.
choices.D: Run the operating system update process.

questions.question_text: A user's workstation was infected with a newly discovered virus that the AV system detected. After a full virus scan and a workstation reboot, the virus is still present in the OS. Which of the following actions should the user take to remove the virus?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Use bootable antivirus media to scan the system.
Here's why:

 Bootable antivirus media: When a virus persists after a full scan and reboot, it might be deeply embedded in the operating system or even in parts of the system that can only be accessed before the OS is fully loaded. Using bootable antivirus media allows the antivirus to scan and clean the system before the virus has a chance to load and resist removal.

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B. Use bootable antivirus media to scan the system.

Explanation:
Bootable antivirus media allows the user to run a virus scan outside the infected operating system. Since the virus is still present after a full scan and reboot, it might be actively interfering with the OS, preventing its removal. By booting from antivirus media, the scan is performed in a clean environment, ensuring the virus is not running and can be effectively removed.

questions.question_text: A user is unable to see transaction details on a website, and nothing happens when the user clicks the details button. Which of the following should the user do to fix this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I can see why people are thinking A, it was my first guess too and I think this is a bad question, because it could be a caching issue but it also could be the details are a window that pops up, and the pop-up blocker.

Selected Answer: A
Clear browser cache, reload.

Selected Answer: A
See Comptia study guide

B. Disable the pop-up blocker.
If the transaction details are likely to open in a new window or tab, a pop-up blocker could be preventing this action. Disabling the pop-up blocker temporarily can help determine if this is the cause of the issue.

The user can then re-enable the pop-up blocker after checking the transaction details.

Google Gemini

questions.question_text: A technician found that an employee is mining cryptocurrency on a work desktop. The company has decided that this action violates its guidelines. Which of the following should be updated to reflect this new requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. AUP = Acceptable Use Policy

Selected Answer: D
An acceptable use policy (AUP), acceptable usage policy or fair use policy is a set of rules applied by the owner, creator or administrator of a computer network, website, or service that restricts the ways in which the network, website or system may be used and sets guidelines as to how it should be used.

Selected Answer: D
Acceptable Use Policy.
